subject: Sleep
title: Stress and Stage Disruption
description: A short lesson to help you apply Stress and Stage Disruption.

hook.text: The night before a big exam, you toss and turn. You sleep but wake feeling like you didn't rest at all.

buildup.text: Stress elevates cortisol and keeps the sympathetic nervous system partially activated during sleep.

discovery.text: High cortisol at night reduces deep sleep and fragments sleep cycles with frequent micro-arousals.

twist.text: Chronic stress creates a feedback loop. Poor sleep increases stress, which further worsens sleep quality.

climax.text: Breaking this cycle often requires addressing the stress itself, not just the sleep symptoms.

punchline.text: A stressed brain can't build the sleep it needs to de-stress.

quiz.question: How does stress affect deep sleep?
options: High cortisol reduces deep sleep and fragments cycles
